feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Logging
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Logging

entry.content: Cloud Logging has removed the quota for write requests per minute, which has been replaced by volume-based regional quotas. We've also removed the references to August dates for the removal of the old quota from the public documentation. For more information, see Logging API quotas and limits.
entry.summary: The previous per-minute write request quota in Cloud Logging has been replaced by volume-based regional quotas. Documentation references to old quota removal dates have also been updated.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Logging Quotas Updated

entry.content:
Java

3.23.4 (2025-09-11)

Bug Fixes
  • deps: Update the Java code generator (gapic-generator-java) to 2.62.1 (1438bff)
Dependencies
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.52.1 (#1853) (c21a635)
  • Update googleapis/sdk-platform-java action to v2.62.1 (#1855) (b6ce498)
entry.summary: A new version of the Java library has been released, including dependency updates and bug fixes.
entry.title: Libraries: New Java Library Version Released

entry.content:
Node.js

11.2.1 (2025-09-03)

Bug Fixes
  • logging: Specifying resourceNames should fetch logs only from those resources (#1597) (ff7899f)
entry.summary: A new version of the Node.js Logging library is available. This update fixes a bug related to specifying resourceNames, ensuring logs are fetched only from the designated resources.
entry.title: Libraries: Node.js Logging Library Update

entry.summary: A new version of the Java Logging library is available.
entry.title: Libraries: Java Logging Library Update

entry.content: You can now build queries without manually writing SQL in the Log Analytics page by using the query builder. This feature is in Public Preview. For more information, see Build and run a SQL query.
entry.summary: You can now build queries without manually writing SQL in the Log Analytics page by using the query builder.
entry.title: Feature: Query Builder for Log Analytics

A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-logging

Bug Fixes

Dependencies
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.50.0 (#1821) (af4edc5)
  • Update googleapis/sdk-platform-java action to v2.60.0 (#1822) (0a96dd5)
entry.summary: This is a weekly digest of client library updates, including bug fixes and dependency updates for the Java client library for Google Cloud Logging.
entry.title: Libraries: Java Client Library Updates

entry.content:
A weekly digest of client library updates from across the Cloud SDK.

Java

Changes for google-cloud-logging

3.22.5 (2025-06-05)

Bug Fixes
  • deps: Update the Java code generator (gapic-generator-java) to 2.59.0 (f2362fb)
Dependencies
  • Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.49.0 (#1813) (c15da84)
entry.summary: This release includes updates to the Java client library for Cloud Logging, specifically version 3.22.5. Key changes involve bug fixes, including an update to the Java code generator, and dependency updates.
entry.title: Libraries: Java client library for Cloud Logging updated

entry.content: Cloud Logging begins enforcement of the new volume-based regional quotas. For more information, see Logging API quotas and limits.
entry.summary: Cloud Logging will start enforcing new regional quotas based on volume. For more details, please refer to the Logging API quotas and limits documentation.
entry.title: Announcement: Cloud Logging Enforces New Volume-Based Quotas

entry.content: You can now cancel a running query in the Logs Explorer by clicking the Stop query button.
entry.summary: You can now cancel a running query in the Logs Explorer by clicking the "Stop query" button.
entry.title: Feature: Stop query button in Logs Explorer

entry.content: You can now configure the observability scope or set the default log scope by using the Google Cloud CLI. You must use version 254.0 or higher. For more information, see Configure observability scopes and Set the default log scope.
entry.summary: You can now set the default log scope or configure the observability scope using the Google Cloud CLI with version 254.0 or higher. For more details, refer to the documentation on configuring observability scopes and setting the default log scope.
entry.title: Feature: Google Cloud CLI now supports observability and log scopes
